name: The Zhili's Last Stand
description: Although the Zhili have been grievously wounded by the murder of Wu Peifu, we shall rise from the ashes like a mighty phoenix. Under the guidance of Jiang Baili and with the help of our old friends in the province, we'll make our last stand here in Sichuan and cast down the Emperor, once and for all.

name: Industrial Expansion
description: The task before us of taking on the traitors that exiled us is a gargantuan one. If we are to take on the Qing, Sichuan's war-torn industrial base won't do. We'll need to double our industrial efforts if we are to reclaim what was stolen from us.

name: Contact An Old Ally
description: Germany has been a friend of the Zhili in the past and shall remain so in the future. Through our connections in the AOG, the Legation Cities and German East Asia, we're in a position to bring in engineers from Krupp to assist us in the construction of new weapon facilities under this German supervision.

name: German Industrial Expertise
description: With our ties to Germany restored and business flourishing, we'll be able to import as many German guns as our gold reserves can purchase. With these weapons we'll be able to rearm our forces for the struggles that lie ahead.

name: Contact the Hubei Generals
description: Assistance from the Europeans may have helped us in the past, but given the number of strings attached to that relationship we might be better off focusing on our Chinese friends rather than the Germans. Our friends in Hubei would be more than capable of helping us restore our economic base.

name: Foreign Arms and Advisors
description: In order to fight the wars that lie ahead we need more guns than our current industry allow us to produce if we are to stand up to the Qing tyrant. By forging new deals and putting our money reserves to good use we should be able to quickly re-equip and retrain our army with foreign help.

name: Gather Allies
description: If we fight the Qing alone, then we'll surely die alone as well. Before any further action is taken against them it would be wise to rally as many potential allies to our cause as we can muster in the region. Luckily for us, there we're hardly the only ones with grievances against Beijing.

name: Behind Manchu Lines
description: Although many of us were chased into exile by Puji, we still have many sympathizers in the old Qing domain that are more than happy to fight for us behind enemy lines. By clandestinely organizing them into proper cells, the Qing army will know no respite as we wreak havoc on them from the shadows.

name: Rally the Zhili Remnants
description: Loyal soldiers and officers alike are worth their weight in gold at this crucial moment. With Sichuan established as the last line of defence for the Zhili, it's imperative that we put out a call to our friends and allies that Sichuan is a safe haven where the long arms of the Qing's secret police can't reach them.

name: Embrace The Civilian Wing
description: We must not unite China under our banner only to become yet another warlord state. Instead, we should welcome civilian rule and adopt a more open model of governance.

name: Political Reform
description: Adapting to civilian rule will require a great overhaul of our old system. We must first lay the groundwork by taking the initial steps towards reforming our administrative structure. This will serve as the framework for our future work.

name: A New Senate
description: No more military councils deciding matters from above without transparency. In the future, the affairs of the Zhili will be decided by a senate that answers to the people, not a clique of haughty warlords like in so many other Chinese provinces.

name: Provincial Centralisation
description: Our administrative structure currently relies on the Sichuanese pre-war system. With it being tailored to a bygone era, we should instead create a unified structure where local mayors and administrators answer to the civilian government in our capital.

name: Bureaucratic Reform
description: The land system is in urgent need for reform. It'll make affairs smoother both for us and our people and would also make it easier for us to integrate regions liberated from the warlords into our administrative structure.

name: Draft a New Constitution
description: The framework of the provisional constitution of the Chinese Republic had its day in the sun, but in the light of our devotion to reform it should be put aside in favour of a new constitution. Modelled after the current ambitions of our new republic rather than the old, it'll grant our people greater freedoms and security.

name: Embrace Meritocracy
description: For far too long military advancement within the army has hinged more on lineage, connections and bribes than actual talent. Now that we're forced to start from scratch, we should remedy this mistake and adopt a strict adherence to meritocratic ideals for the Zhili army.

name: Reform the Military
description: We'll reform the army in every sense of the word. With the leadership improved and without the dead weight from years of nepotism and corruption, it's time that we enacted reforms to modernize our army structure and doctrine to reflect these advancements on the battlefield as well.

name: Continue Military Primacy
description: The murder of the Jade Marshal must not go unpunished. His work shall serve as the model for our new government in Sichuan, one that will put justice above all else in these uncertain times. Under the guidance of our talented army staff, we'll restore order and honor to the Zhili.

name: Restore the 1923 Constitution
description: Cao Kun's service and sacrifice will not be forgotten. He may have been murdered along with Wu, but his legacy will live on through the constitution he drafted in 1923. It will provide the people with the security they deserve, both here in Sichuan as well as Beijing when we return home.

name: Control the Civilian Government
description: We cannot let the whims of a few bureaucrats derail our agenda with their ill-informed objections. The final word should always come from the military and we'll make sure that every step of the way the local administrators understand and adhere to this fact.

name: Crush Internal Dissent
description: Despite our best efforts, there are still those that do not understand their place by putting personal interests ahead of the nation. One way or another, we'll educate them until they understand what's best for them. We cannot let dissent against the army strengthen our enemies in this crucial moment.

name: Embrace Militarism
description: To best face the challenges that lie ahead our society will need be a militant one. From top to bottom, we'll embrace the virtues of military service and honor the military. This will instill our soldiers with a greater sense of duty and valor, putting them well above the rabble our enemy is sure to field.

name: Academy-Trained Officers
description: By refining our training methods, we'll have our officers and soldiers drilled to a point where they'll be better equipped not only to adapt to battlefield developments, but we'll be more resilient to any loss of institutional knowledge through battlefield losses as well thanks to our emphasis on drill and discipline.

name: Military Intelligence
description: We must always be three steps ahead of our enemies. By giving more freedom to our military intelligence branch to act unrestrained, we'll know every move our enemy makes, be it a foreign or internal threat. The people of Sichuan and beyond can sleep soundly at night knowing that they're protected by such valiant men.

name: Prepare The Final Offensive
description: Everything is in place for the final push. Our entire society backs our effort and the military will have nothing holding them back as we reclaim what was taken from ours. The murder of the Jade Marshal will soon be avenged!

name: Shining Republic
description: We have proven ourselves to be the legitimate government of China, despite the best efforts of the conspirators in Beijing. Soon the time will come to turn our rightful claims into reality and depose of the Manchu and we must work hard to prepare for that day when it arrives.

name: Kickstart the Armament Industry
description: The defeat of the Qing did not bring peace to China. We need to prepare for the seemingly inevitable conflicts that lie ahead by prioritizing military production as a key part of our reconstruction effort.

name: Expand the Shanxi Coal Fields
description: Seized from Yan Xishan at the end of the last Zhifeng war, the coal fields of Shanxi are some of the most prosperous in China. We should invest in these coal fields, in order to fuel the reconstruction efforts.

name: Expand Gongxian Arsenal
description: The Gongxian Arsenal has normally played second fiddle to the much larger Hanyang weapons foundry. Yet by expanding its manufacturing capabilities, we can sufficiently spread out our industrial base in case one arsenal falls into the hands of invaders.

name: Expand Baoding Arsenal
description: The Baoding arsenal, attached to the famous military academy, is somewhat less developed than the Gongxian foundry. Yet with enough investments, we can turn it into one of China's main military manufacturers. Its proximity to the Academy is also a plus, as it allows us to test new equipment designs both practically and theoretically.

name: Rebuild Beijing
description: Much of Beijing still bears its scars after the strife and fighting the city has seen in recent years. Now that we've retaken the city from the Qing, we must work hard to mend these scars and rebuild the ancient city as the industrial and commercial nerve center of China.

name: Expand the Jinghan Railroad
description: With much of the country being devastated by recent conflicts, extending the reach of the Jinghan Railroad will go a long way to to both rebuild the country and connect its many provinces.

name: Daye-Hanyang Development Scheme
description: The Daye-Hanyang corridor houses the majority of our industrial capacity outside of Beijing, but its infrastructure and factories were badly damaged by the recent fighting. By investing into rebuilding the region with more modern civilian and military industries, we'll bring this region back to life.

name: Renovate the Kailuan Mining Bureau
description: The Kailuan mining Bureau was founded in 1878 as a joint venture between the Qing government and a variety of British business interests. Largely destroyed during the fighting of the warlord era and more recent conflicts, we must rebuild and reorganize the mines to fuel our war efforts.

name: One China, One Government
description: For far too long, China has been divided between warlord domains, party-states and decentralists. No longer - with Beijing on our hands, we shall set upon a campaign to truly reunify China and we will not stop until all of China answers to one government - *ours*.

name: War of National Resistance
description: Ever since we lost the war of 1894, Japan's aggression against China has been ceaseless and merciless. Now we must once more fight to protect our homes from them and their invading lapdogs. We will give no quarter to those who seek to humiliate and destroy China!

name: Eradicate the Concessions
description: These so-called concessions are a holdover of European and Japanese injustices against China. They'll be given a choice to be returned to Chinese control either by the pen or by the sword. One way or another, this century of humiliation they wrought will end here.

name: National Unification
description: The age of warlords and self-serving tyrants needs to come to an end. By declaring to the world that we're the legitimate Chinese republic, we'll rally many nationalistic fighters and intellectuals alike to our cause. Together we'll make China united and whole once more.

name: Tie Up Loose Ends
description: Now all that remains is to secure the territory we claim outside of the heartland of China. Mongolia, Tibet and other far-flung provinces must be brought to heel!

name: Triumphant Return
description: We rose from the ashes after the Qing thought they'd destroyed us. Now they and everyone else that stood with them against us have been humbled by our victories. We must consolidate our position and restore order to China after all the damage that the Qing and their ilk have caused and let everyone know - the Zhili are here to stay.

name: Deal with the Conspirators
description: Everyone involved in the conspiracy that led to the murders of Wu Peifu and Cao Kun and caused the subsequent chaos of the illegitimate Manchu restoration need to pay for their crimes. With the long reach of our secret police, we'll root out all conspirators and make them face justice for what they've done.

name: Purge the Baoding Cliques
description: The coup against us which led to the murder of the Jade Marshal was made possible with the collaboration of cadets from Baoding. To protect the future of our republic we'll need to use any means necessary to round up those responsible and erase any trace of influence they once held.

name: End the Manchu Legacy
description: At the rotten core of this mess lie the criminal Manchu dynasty and their cronies. Their past crimes have proven that merely removing them from power isn't enough. Their entire structure of corrupt influence needs to be destroyed and their dynastic name relegated to the dustbin of history.

name: Placate the Intelligentsia
description: The intellectuals in Beijing and beyond have been agitating for decades and clearly aren't going away any time soon. A few token reforms and tactical rewards, with the clear understanding that the stick can easily replace this carrot, will make the majority of them less troublesome for the foreseeable future.
